section.heading: Execution of warrants.
section.text: Any warrant for search or arrest, issued by any judge of the District, may be executed in any part of the District by any member of the police force, without any backing or indorsement of the warrant, and according to the terms thereof; and all provisions of law in relation to bail in the District shall apply to this chapter.

annotations.annotation: Pursuant to the District of Columbia Court Reorganization Act of 1970, “judge” was substituted for “magistrate” in this section.
Service of process, Criminal Division of Superior Court, see § 16-703.
Search warrants, time of execution, see § 23-523.
Search warrants, execution under Controlled Substances Act, see § 48-921.02.
Search warrants, illegal alcoholic beverages, see § 25-803.
Search warrants, duties under, see § 23-523 et seq.
Arrests, officers pursuing fugitive into District, see § 23-901.
